titleStmt.title: A seasonable address to both Houses of Parliament concerning the succession, the fears of popery, and arbitrary government by a true Protestant, and hearty lover of his country.
titleStmt.author: Halifax, George Savile, Marquis of, 1633-1695.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to George Savile, Marquis of Halifax. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
